_header: Saint Bridget of high men in Scotland she came
Subjects: saints’ lives; Bridget, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Bridget (shorter version) in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEinte Bride of heiȝe men In scotlond heo camOf riche men and
                    of gret power In lawe of cristindom…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Þe furste dai of feuerer hire liif heo brouȝte to
                    endeGod us graunti alle forth with hire to blisse of heuene
                    wende
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 192-3.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Bride of wel heȝe men in to Scotlonde comRiche and of
                    gret power in lawe of cristendom…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…God lete vs forþ wiþ hire to þe blisse of heuene
                    wendeÞat God haþ i ordeyned þat lasteþ wiþ outen
                    ende. A.M.E.N.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Bride of hegh men out of Scotlond comeRiche & of grete
                    power in lawe of cristendome…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Þe firste day of ffebruare hir lyf she broȝt to
                    endeSich blisse as she disserved her Ihesu Crist vs sende Amen
